parametrized_description: A chocolate shop produces two types of chocolate bars: milk and dark. Producing one milk chocolate bar requires CocoaPerMilkBar units of cocoa and MilkPerMilkBar units of milk. Producing one dark chocolate bar requires CocoaPerDarkBar units of cocoa and MilkPerDarkBar units of milk. The shop has TotalCocoa units of cocoa and TotalMilk units of milk available. At least MinMilkToDarkRatio times as many milk chocolate bars as dark chocolate bars must be produced. Producing one milk chocolate bar takes TimePerMilkBar minutes and producing one dark chocolate bar takes TimePerDarkBar minutes. The objective is to determine the number of each type of bar to produce in order to minimize the total production time.

CocoaPerMilkBar.description: Amount of cocoa required to produce one milk chocolate bar

MilkPerMilkBar.description: Amount of milk required to produce one milk chocolate bar

CocoaPerDarkBar.description: Amount of cocoa required to produce one dark chocolate bar

MilkPerDarkBar.description: Amount of milk required to produce one dark chocolate bar

MinMilkToDarkRatio.description: Minimum ratio of milk chocolate bars to dark chocolate bars

TimePerMilkBar.description: Time required to produce one milk chocolate bar in minutes

TimePerDarkBar.description: Time required to produce one dark chocolate bar in minutes

MilkBars.description: The number of milk chocolate bars produced

DarkBars.description: The number of dark chocolate bars produced

constraints.description: The total cocoa used to produce milk and dark chocolate bars does not exceed TotalCocoa units.
The total milk used to produce milk and dark chocolate bars does not exceed TotalMilk units.
The number of milk chocolate bars produced is at least MinMilkToDarkRatio times the number of dark chocolate bars produced.

objective.description: Minimize the total production time, which is the sum of the time required to produce the milk and dark chocolate bars.
